intro: Gentiana luteoviridis, commonly known as the yellow-green gentian, is a species of flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Gentianaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky soils, preferring cool and moist environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in a fine, white pubescence, while its stems are often branched and sturdy. The flowers are tubular and attract various pollinators, including bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological significance in its native habitat.
